      This method checks whether there are any adjacent balls present on the board.
      boolean columnFreeSpace​(int index)
      This method checks whether the column of index in the parameter has at least one free space.
      int commandDirection​(int command)
      This method sorts the possible commands based on the direction, which are: left, right, up, down.

      This method returns the row/col index which should be moved by the command

      This method checks the command is moving a row or a column

      This method creates a copy of the board with it's current state.

      This method checks whether there is at least one valid double move possible in the current state of the game.

      This method checks for all the possible valid double moves on the board and adds the corresponding commands to a list of Integer arrays.

      This method checks whether the two moves in the argument of the method are valid for a double move.

      This method checks whether the game has reached its' end.

      This method returns the tiles in the row of index in the parameter.
      int getTileColor​(int rowIndex, int colIndex)
      Checks the color of a specific coordinate on the board and returns the color stored in that board
      int[][] getTiles()
      This method makes use of the raw board array to generate a two dimensional board array for an easier cartesian access to the slots on the board

      This method randomly generates the tiles of the board, checks for their validity (no adjacent tiles of same color allowed), checks if board has initial moves, and sets the 2D board array.

      This method moves the lines up, down, left, or right.

    • Field Detail

      • DIM

        public static final int DIM
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TILES

        public static final int[] TILES

      • rowBoard

        public int[] rowBoard
        The DIM by DIM fields of the Tic Tac Toe board. The possible colors are represented by TILES (6 colors)

      • fields

        public int[][] fields

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()

    • Method Detail

      • initBoard

        public void initBoard()
        This method randomly generates the tiles of the board, checks for their validity (no adjacent tiles of same color allowed), checks if board has initial moves, and sets the 2D board array.

      • getTiles

        public int[][] getTiles()
        This method makes use of the raw board array to generate a two dimensional board array for an easier cartesian access to the slots on the board
        Returns:
        the two dimensional array of board tiles

      • getRandomIntegerBetweenRange

        public int getRandomIntegerBetweenRange​(int min,
                                        int max)
        This method generates a random primitive integer in range (min, max)
        Returns:
        randomly generated integer

      • possibleMovements

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> possibleMovements()
        This method checks which are the lines that can be moved and returns the list of the possible commands in the moment of the execution of the method.
        Returns:
        list of currently available commands

      • singleMovePossible

        public boolean singleMovePossible()
        This method checks whether there is at least one valid single move possible in the current state of the game.
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one valid single move possible

      • doubleMovePossible

        public boolean doubleMovePossible()
        This method checks whether there is at least one valid double move possible in the current state of the game.
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one valid double move possible

      • singleMoveValid

        public boolean singleMoveValid​(int move)
        This method checks whether the move in the argument of the method is a valid single move.
        Parameters:
        move - represents the command or line to move and direction
        Returns:
        True if the single move leads to at least one pair of adjacent balls of the same color

      • doubleMoveValid

        public boolean doubleMoveValid​(int move1,
                               int move2)
        This method checks whether the two moves in the argument of the method are valid for a double move.
        Parameters:
        move1 - represents the first command or line to move and direction
        move2 - represents the second command or line to move and direction
        Returns:
        True if there are no single moves available, and if the first move gives the possibility to the second move to lead to at least one pair of adjacent balls of the same color.

      • singleMovesList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> singleMovesList()
        This method checks for all the possible valid single moves on the board and adds the corresponding commands to a list of Integers
        Returns:
        the list of all possible valid single moves

      • doubleMovesList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer[]> doubleMovesList()
        This method checks for all the possible valid double moves on the board and adds the corresponding commands to a list of Integer arrays.
        Returns:
        the list of all possible valid double moves

      • columnFreeSpace

        public boolean columnFreeSpace​(int index)
        This method checks whether the column of index in the parameter has at least one free space.
        Parameters:
        index - of the column
        Returns:
        True if the column has at least one free space

      • rowFreeSpace

        public boolean rowFreeSpace​(int index)
        This method checks whether the row of index in the parameter has at least one free space.
        Parameters:
        index - of the row
        Returns:
        True if the row has at least one free space

      • removeBalls

        public int[] removeBalls()
        This method removes the adjacent balls on the board and counts the colors of each removed ball.
        Returns:
        array of integers representing the amount of balls per color.

      • moveLine

        public void moveLine​(int command)
        This method moves the lines up, down, left, or right. The method iterates from left in case of moving left or up. The method iterates from right in case of moving right or down.
        Parameters:
        command - between 0-27

      • deepCopy

        public Board deepCopy()
        This method creates a copy of the board with it's current state.
        Returns:
        new Board copy of the board

      • adjacentBallsPresent

        public boolean adjacentBallsPresent()
        This method checks whether there are any adjacent balls present on the board.
        Returns:
        True if there's at least one pair of adjacent balls on the board.

      • isMove

        public boolean isMove​(int move)
        This method checks whether the move is valid
        Parameters:
        move - between 0-27
        Returns:
        False is the move not in range

      • scoreCounter

        public int scoreCounter​(int[] tiles)
        This method calculates the store of the incoming array of tiles
        Parameters:
        tiles - containes the array of scored tiles
        Returns:
        one point for every 3 tiles of the same color.

      • commandDirection

        public int commandDirection​(int command)
        This method sorts the possible commands based on the direction, which are: left, right, up, down.
        Parameters:
        command - between 0-27
        Returns:
        the direction index between 0 and 3 where:

        0 stands for left 1 stands for right 2 stands for up 3 stands for down

      • commandRowColumn

        public boolean commandRowColumn​(int command)
        This method checks the command is moving a row or a column
        Parameters:
        command - between 0-27
        Returns:
        True if it is a row, false if a column.

      • commandIndex

        public int commandIndex​(int command)
        This method returns the row/col index which should be moved by the command
        Parameters:
        command - between 0-27
        Returns:
        an integer between 0 and 6 which represents the row/column index

      • getRow

        public int[] getRow​(int index)
        This method returns the tiles in the row of index in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        index - between 0-6
        Returns:
        array of tiles in the row.

      • getColumn

        public int[] getColumn​(int index)
        This method returns the tiles in the column of index in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        index - between 0-6
        Returns:
        array of tiles in the column.

      • setTileColumn

        public void setTileColumn​(int colIndex,
                          int tileIndex,
                          int newTile)
        This method sets a tile to a new tile in a specific column of index colIndex.
        Parameters:
        colIndex - represents the index of the column
        tileIndex - represents the index of the tile in the column colIndex
        newTile - represents the new tile color

      • setTileRow

        public void setTileRow​(int rowIndex,
                       int tileIndex,
                       int newTile)
        This method sets a tile to a new tile in a specific row of index rowIndex.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - represents the index of the row
        tileIndex - represents the index of the tile in the row rowIndex
        newTile - represents the new tile color

      • setTile

        public void setTile​(int rowIndex,
                    int colIndex,
                    int newTile)
        This method sets a tile to a new tile by using regular cartesian coordinate x y.
        Parameters:
        colIndex - represents the index of the column
        rowIndex - represents the index of the tile in the column
        newTile - represents the new tile color

      • getTileColor

        public int getTileColor​(int rowIndex,
                        int colIndex)
        Checks the color of a specific coordinate on the board and returns the color stored in that board
        Parameters:
        colIndex - represents the index of the column
        rowIndex - represents the index of the tile in the column
        Returns:
        int value of the tile color

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        This method checks whether the game has reached its' end.
        Returns:
        True if there are no possible moves remaining.

      • adjacentBalls

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer[]> adjacentBalls()
        This method checks for all the adjacent balls currently present on the board. The coordinates of each adjacent ball on the board is returned in an array of Integers.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of all the adjacent balls on the board in a two dimensional array list.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns the visualization of the board and the respective commands helpers to a string
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String visualization of the board
